scenes.label: *start
texts: We'd been walking for like five minutes, holding hands.
She was pretty friendly when she called out to me at the Sun Plaza, but she hadn't said a word since.
Honestly, this was freaky as hell. I had no idea what she was thinking.
I sure as hell didn't know any girls with a fit as weird as hers, or with AR tattoos on their cheeks.
I thought maybe she was changing her appearance like those guys at the AR café, but when I turned off my BMI, she looked exactly the same.
I couldn't see her profile either.
It wasn't that she set it to private—it didn't even exist.
If you wanted to run anything in this day and age—even if it wasn't BMI-based—you had to register a profile with at least a little info.
That she didn't even have one could only mean two things: either she had no devices at all, or she'd deleted her profile with a hack.
The midsummer sun smiles and beams... At the cheer invited by the southern wind...
A wondrous magic will soon show its gleams...
The omen of tears...and joy undimmed...
It was the first thing she'd said in minutes and...she was talking to herself. Or was it a poem or something?
Whatever it was, I didn't know how to react. It sure didn't feel like my cue to start a conversation.
I really had no idea how to handle girls...
Was I supposed to shake her hand off mine? Or just wait until she said something else?
She suddenly stopped to look around.
Still holding my hand, she took us into a small park nearby.
It was evening, but there wasn't anybody around.
What was she planning to do here?
If it was, the ideal outcome would be that this whole thing was a prank by Wind and them, and they were about to pop out, like "GOT YOU LMAO!"
The bad-but-not-quite-worst-case scenario would be that she was the signal for a bunch of huge guys to come give me the shakedown of my life.
But then the worst-case scenario would be that Kido and his goons found out what I did, and they were using this girl as bait to get to me.
I had to blend in with the crowd. It's easier when you pretend to be a couple.
So she used me, huh? That sure was some shit.
The girl finally let go of my hand.
Wait. I wasn't about to let her control the conversation. I had to take the initiative.
You better explain yourself...and your situation.
As if stuff like this actually happens! That's the same name! I was waiting for a girl with that name!
Hey, I really don't think we should write this off as a coincidence.
I'm sorry. I meant it as an alias.
It's just...what I want you to call me...for now.
If it doesn't offend the Momo you know, that is.
Oh yeah, I'd called her "Momo" without really thinking.
And now, since she didn't want to give me her real name, she just used the name she got from me.
I felt stupid for getting so excited.
Oh. Is she your girlfriend, then?
Ugh... That staring was too much!
...Momo Aizaki is just a name I made up!
Why'd you make me admit it?!
She hadn't even given me her real name, but off she went sticking her nose into my personal life.
Please, feel free to call me Momo.
She seriously had no devices at all?
But then...why do you have an AR tattoo?
She didn't even know it was there? Had someone put it there without telling her?
Don't ask me! Call me whatever!
...Anyway, tell me what's up with you.
Well...I'm looking for someone, but I don't have any leads. I'm also by myself, so...I'm kind of at a loss.
And if she was looking for someone, why did she have to pretend to be my gf to blend in with the crowd?
Why'd you call out to me?
But I do remember having an image—someone's face—flash into my mind, shortly before I met you.
Looking back, that face might've been yours.
Perhaps that was why I called out to you back there. I did it without even thinking.
Crap. I needed to stay in control of the situation. Calm down, Pollon!
Th-that's barely an answer. And that's not my point, either.
For a person who's looking for someone, you seem awful concerned about getting spotted. What are you hiding?
You used me, yeah? I've got the right to know, then, don'tcha think?
Ah. Shit. Was I being too harsh? No way, pretty sure I was in the right...
I could tell from her face that she was pretty tired.
I put our chat on hold so we could go to a nearby vending machine. I got two bottles of milk tea, then handed one to her.
Yeah. This is, uh...my thanks to you. Kinda.
It was thanks to Momo that I'd gotten away with that elopement story, so things weren't all bad.
I held out the bottle towards her. Kinda forcefully.
She accepted it politely, then took a hesitant sip.
Suddenly, a single tear rolled down her cheek.
She wiped away her tears with the back of her hand, like a child.
I had no idea what to say, so I simply stood and watched.
She stopped crying after a little while, then looked up at me with bashful eyes.
Hey, just drink it. It'll get cold.
I had no idea she'd be this grateful.
It seemed like this girl had been walking around for way too long. She looked like she was mentally exhausted.
Still, she showed no sign of telling me what was up. Maybe she had some serious problems.
Hell, she couldn't even tell me her real name.
Her clothing sure as hell wasn't street-worthy.
There was that weird AR tattoo on her face too.
She didn't use BMI, and had no other devices.
The more I talked to her, the more perplexed I got, but I didn't feel like she was up to anything sketchy.
And as long as someone was in need, then I had to do what I had to do.
Good thing you called out to me, though. You're in luck.
I run a team called "Nakano Symphonies." I mean, it's just me and this other guy... But anyways, remember the name!
I'll tell you what Nakano Symphonies is all about.
We're a team of anons with bright futures, who can't sit idly by when someone's in need.
Looks like fate brought us together, so I'm gonna help ya.
C'mon, lay it on me. It's all good.
Better to share your troubles than hold them in so much that you cry, right?
Whatever it is, I'll take care of it. Leave it to me.
Now that I'd made my cool speech, there was no way she wouldn't open up.
I'm sorry. Thank you for the offer.
But I'd just told her I wasn't gonna take no for an answer!
It looked like Momo had no intention of opening up, and I had absolutely no idea how to continue the conversation.
Women and their enigmatic minds! The best hacker in the world couldn't crack their brains!
